An epic journey ensues when one of the clan named Migo stumbles across a real human being - but is banished from his snowy home when no-one believes him. Animated adventure, with the voices of Channing Tatum and James Corden

programme.title: Kung Fu Panda
programme.desc: A hero is needed to defend a peaceful valley community from attack by a rampaging snow leopard. The unlikely candidate for the job is a lazy panda, who enlists the aid of a legendary team of animal fighters and their wise master to teach him the martial arts skills he needs to fulfil his destiny. Animated comedy, with the voices of Jack Black, Dustin Hoffman, Angelina Jolie, Ian McShane and Jackie Chan

programme.title: Kung Fu Panda 3
programme.desc: The clumsy hero is reunited with his long-lost father, whose help he will need when a supernatural foe threatens all of China. Father and son travel to a secret village populated by other pandas, and must train them in martial arts so they can defend their home. Animated comedy sequel, with the voices of Jack Black, Bryan Cranston, Angelina Jolie and Dustin Hoffman

programme.title: Cloudy with a Chance of Meatballs
programme.desc: An incompetent scientist finally invents something that works - a machine that turns water into food. When the device gets launched into the atmosphere, it has a strange effect on his towns weather, causing giant meals to fall from the sky to the delight of the residents - until it gets out of control. Animated comedy, with the voices of Bill Hader, Anna Faris and James Caan

programme.title: Cloudy with a Chance of Meatballs 2
programme.desc: A scientist believes he has saved the world from his invention, a machine that accidentally turned water into food. However, he learns the device is still active and has created a race of food/animal hybrids that he must stop from running wild across the world. Animated comedy sequel, with the voices of Bill Hader, Anna Faris and James Caan

programme.title: Piece By Piece
programme.desc: Pharrell Williams tells the story of his life - through the lens of Lego animation. With an all-star cast, including Kendrick Lamar, Gwen Stefani and Snoop Dogg

programme.title: Noahs Ark
programme.desc: Tom and Vini are mice who stow away on Noahs ark. They must use their musical talents to enter a competition and help maintain peace among the animals. Animated adventure, featuring the voices of Rodrigo Santoro and Marcelo Adnet

programme.title: Teen Titans Go! To The Movies
programme.desc: Five teenage superheroes, miffed by the fact they arent deemed worthy enough for their own big screen films, set out to prove themselves by tackling the villainous Slade and his maniacal plan for world domination. Animated adventure, featuring the voices of Greg Cipes, Scott Menville, Khary Payton, Will Arnett and Nicolas Cage

programme.title: Four Christmases
programme.desc: A couple have always managed to avoid family festivities by travelling overseas. However, when their flight is cancelled, each of their divorced parents insists they spend yuletide with them - forcing the pair to get through a quartet of Christmas celebrations on the same day. Comedy, starring Vince Vaughn and Reese Witherspoon

programme.title: National Lampoons Christmas Vacation
programme.desc: An American householder is dismayed when his plans for a traditional festive family holiday are thrown into complete disarray by a succession of annoying neighbours and long-lost relatives, who turn up on his doorstep offering their own brand of Christmas cheer. Comedy, starring Chevy Chase, Beverly DAngelo, Randy Quaid, Diane Ladd, Juliette Lewis, Miriam Flynn, Johnny Galecki and William Hickey

programme.title: Its a Wonderful Life
programme.desc: A hard-working, small-town businessman comes to think his life has been a complete waste of time and tries to commit suicide. At the last minute, his guardian angel pays him a visit and makes him realise his true worth by showing him what would have happened to those around him had he never been born. Fantasy drama, starring James Stewart, Donna Reed, Lionel Barrymore, Henry Travers, Beulah Bondi, Thomas Mitchell and Frank Faylen

programme.title: Love Actually
programme.desc: Ten interlinked stories of people searching for and finding love. While the newly elected, bachelor British prime minister is smitten by a junior staff member at 10 Downing Street, a heartbroken writer heads for France to get over a failed relationship, and a faded rock star aims to reinvent himself in time for Christmas. Richard Curtiss romantic comedy, with Hugh Grant, Martine McCutcheon, Emma Thompson, Alan Rickman, Colin Firth, Bill Nighy and Liam Neeson

programme.title: The Best Christmas Pageant Ever
programme.desc: Nobody is ready for the mayhem that ensues when six of the worst youngsters disrupt the towns annual Christmas performance. Festive comedy based on the Barbara Robinson novel, starring Lauren Graham, Judy Greer and Pete Holmes

programme.title: Elf
programme.desc: A child is taken in by kind-hearted Santa and raised as an elf - so it comes as a shock when he discovers years later that he is in fact human. Deciding to get back to his roots, he heads off for New York in search of his long-lost family, but is ill-prepared for the hustle and bustle of the Big Apple. Fantasy comedy, starring Will Ferrell, James Caan, Zooey Deschanel and Edward Asner

programme.title: The Grinch
programme.desc: In the magical town of Whoville, a race of human-like creatures called Whos are thrilled about celebrating Christmas. However, a cantankerous, furry green loner named the Grinch, who lives in a cave north of Whoville, hatches a dastardly scheme to ruin the festive season. Animated Dr Seuss adaptation, with the voices of Benedict Cumberbatch, Pharrell Williams and Rashida Jones

programme.title: Youve Got Mail
programme.desc: Two rivals in the bookshop business fall in love over the internet, unaware they know and dislike each other in the real world. While things remain frosty in person, the pairs anonymous online relationship continues to blossom. Romantic comedy, starring Tom Hanks, Meg Ryan, Greg Kinnear, Parker Posey and Dabney Coleman.

programme.title: Elf
programme.desc: A child is taken in by kind-hearted Santa and raised as an elf - so it comes as a shock when he discovers years later that he is in fact human. Deciding to get back to his roots, he heads off for New York in search of his long-lost family, but is ill-prepared for the hustle and bustle of the Big Apple. Fantasy comedy, starring Will Ferrell, James Caan, Zooey Deschanel and Edward Asner

programme.title: Christmas with the Kranks
programme.desc: A married couple from Chicago decide to steer clear of the usual festive celebrations and keep their cash for a holiday in the sun, prompting a busybody neighbour to call on the local community to pull out all the stops to make them change their minds. Festive comedy based on a novel by John Grisham, starring Jamie Lee Curtis, Tim Allen, Dan Aykroyd and M Emmet Walsh

programme.title: Snow Day
programme.desc: A New York borough is shut down during a blizzard - and a group of cheeky local children steal a snowplough in a desperate attempt to ensure the roads to their school stay closed as long as possible. Meanwhile, parents all over the city struggle to work out what to do with their offspring. Comedy, starring Chris Elliott, Mark Webber, Jean Smart, Chevy Chase, Iggy Pop, Pam Grier and Zena Grey

programme.title: Surviving Christmas
programme.desc: A millionaire feels unfulfilled in spite of his great fortune. He decides a traditional family Christmas is the thing that is missing from his life, so he hires a family to spend the season of goodwill with him. Unfortunately, the plan goes haywire with the arrival of an unexpected guest. Comedy, starring Ben Affleck, James Gandolfini, Christina Applegate and Catherine OHara

programme.title: Sky Cinema Preview-Nov 2025
programme.desc: Previews of the films now playing on Sky Cinema plus other highlights showing on Sky

programme.title: Prancer: A Christmas Tale
programme.desc: Ten-year-old Gloria and her recently widowed grandfather Bud befriend a mysterious reindeer when the family gathers for Christmas. Bud comes to believe that Prancer may actually be magical, but Gloria fears his theory will send him straight to a retirement home. Festive family drama, starring James Cromwell and Darcey Ewart

programme.title: A Boy Called Christmas
programme.desc: An ordinary boy, with a loyal pet mouse and a reindeer at his side, sets out on an extraordinary adventure to find his father, who is on a quest to discover the fabled village of Elfhelm. Festive family adventure, starring Henry Lawfull, Toby Jones, Sally Hawkins and Kristen Wiig

programme.title: Arthur Christmas
programme.desc: Santa Claus gift-giving routine has developed into a complex hi-tech operation. However, when one girl is accidentally missed out, his youngest son Arthur takes control of the family sleigh to deliver her gifts the old-fashioned way - but following in his fathers footsteps is not as easy as it looks. Animated comedy, with the voices of James McAvoy, Jim Broadbent and Bill Nighy

programme.title: Elf
programme.desc: A child is taken in by kind-hearted Santa and raised as an elf - so it comes as a shock when he discovers years later that he is in fact human. Deciding to get back to his roots, he heads off for New York in search of his long-lost family, but is ill-prepared for the hustle and bustle of the Big Apple. Fantasy comedy, starring Will Ferrell, James Caan, Zooey Deschanel and Edward Asner

programme.title: Youve Got Mail
programme.desc: Two rivals in the bookshop business fall in love over the internet, unaware they know and dislike each other in the real world. While things remain frosty in person, the pairs anonymous online relationship continues to blossom. Romantic comedy, starring Tom Hanks, Meg Ryan, Greg Kinnear, Parker Posey and Dabney Coleman.

programme.title: National Lampoons Christmas Vacation
programme.desc: An American householder is dismayed when his plans for a traditional festive family holiday are thrown into complete disarray by a succession of annoying neighbours and long-lost relatives, who turn up on his doorstep offering their own brand of Christmas cheer. Comedy, starring Chevy Chase, Beverly DAngelo, Randy Quaid, Diane Ladd, Juliette Lewis, Miriam Flynn, Johnny Galecki and William Hickey

programme.title: Little Women
programme.desc: Four sisters are raised by their strong-willed mother while their father is away fighting in the American Civil War. Although one yearns to become a writer and another dreams of being married, the girls remain firmly united as the family steers a course through hard times and tragic events. Period drama, based on Louisa May Alcotts novel, with Winona Ryder, Susan Sarandon, Claire Danes, Samantha Mathis and Kirsten Dunst

programme.title: The Holiday
programme.desc: Two single women living on opposite sides of the Atlantic agree to exchange houses over the Christmas holidays. In their new surroundings, both women unexpectedly encounter prospective partners, but as the house swap draws to a close, difficult decisions have to be made about their blossoming relationships. Romantic comedy, starring Cameron Diaz, Kate Winslet, Jack Black, Jude Law and Eli Wallach

programme.title: Love Actually
programme.desc: Ten interlinked stories of people searching for and finding love. While the newly elected, bachelor British prime minister is smitten by a junior staff member at 10 Downing Street, a heartbroken writer heads for France to get over a failed relationship, and a faded rock star aims to reinvent himself in time for Christmas. Richard Curtiss romantic comedy, with Hugh Grant, Martine McCutcheon, Emma Thompson, Alan Rickman, Colin Firth, Bill Nighy and Liam Neeson

programme.title: Happy Christmas
programme.desc: A woman moves in with her brother and his family after her latest break-up. She begins a relationship with a drug dealer who babysits the couples two-year-old son, while also trying to persuade her sister-in-law that she needs to try and get more out of her life. Comedy drama, starring Anna Kendrick, Melanie Lynskey and Lena Dunham

programme.title: Snow Day
programme.desc: A New York borough is shut down during a blizzard - and a group of cheeky local children steal a snowplough in a desperate attempt to ensure the roads to their school stay closed as long as possible. Meanwhile, parents all over the city struggle to work out what to do with their offspring. Comedy, starring Chris Elliott, Mark Webber, Jean Smart, Chevy Chase, Iggy Pop, Pam Grier and Zena Grey

programme.title: Look Whos Talking Too
programme.desc: Wisecracking toddler Mikey is joined by mischievous baby sister Julie and sibling rivalry inevitably erupts - while their parents have problems of their own to deal with, in the shape of the kids good-for-nothing uncle. Comedy sequel, starring John Travolta and Kirstie Alley, with the voices of Bruce Willis and Rosanne Barr

programme.title: Bean
programme.desc: The hapless fool is employed as a security guard for a British art gallery and is sent to Los Angeles to bring back a famous painting. Unfortunately, he finds himself mistaken for a renowned art professor and invited to make an important presentation. Mel Smiths British comedy, starring Rowan Atkinson, Burt Reynolds, Peter MacNicol, John Mills, Peter Capaldi and June Brown

programme.title: The Wizard of Oz
programme.desc: Youngster Dorothy Gale is whisked over the rainbow by a tornado into the magical land of Oz, where she inadvertently kills a wicked witch - incurring the wrath of another. Setting out to find the wizard who can show her a way home, she is joined on her journey by a scarecrow, a tin man and a cowardly lion, who all hope their own wishes will be granted. Musical fantasy, with Judy Garland, Ray Bolger, Jack Haley, Bert Lahr and Frank Morgan

programme.title: Sonic the Hedgehog 3
programme.desc: The blue hedgehog, Knuckles and Tails reunite to face the might of the villainous Shadow, who possesses powers unlike anything they have seen before. Outmuscled on every front, Sonic seeks help from an unlikely source, Dr Ivo Robotnik. Fantasy adventure sequel based on the videogame, starring Jim Carrey, James Marsden and Tika Sumpter

programme.title: The SpongeBob SquarePants Movie
programme.desc: The plucky sea creature sets out to prove his boss Mr Krabs is innocent of stealing Neptunes crown. However, the missing item has ended up in sinister Shell City, which all sea-dwellers fear and from which few have ever returned. Animated comedy, with the voices of Tom Kenny, Bill Fagerbakke, Clancy Brown and Scarlett Johansson, plus a cameo appearance by David Hasselhoff

programme.title: The Golden Child
programme.desc: A private eye is recruited by a group of Buddhist mystics and sent on a mission to rescue an abducted boy whose supernatural powers will enable him to bring about world peace. However, the kidnapper is actually a demon in human form, determined to ensure the youngster does not fulfil his destiny. Comedy fantasy adventure, starring Eddie Murphy, Charles Dance and Charlotte Lewis

programme.title: Look Whos Talking Now
programme.desc: A family takes in two pet dogs, a scruffy mongrel with discipline problems and a prim and proper pedigree poodle, whose personality clashes create all sorts of mayhem for the household. Comedy sequel, starring John Travolta and Kirstie Alley, plus the voices of Diane Keaton and Danny DeVito as the canine duo

programme.title: Small Soldiers
programme.desc: A hi-tech computer chip has a bizarre effect on a squad of toy soldiers, causing mayhem for their owner as the miniature marauders engage in a series of scaled-down skirmishes. Childrens adventure mixing live action and computer animation, starring Kirsten Dunst, Denis Leary and Gregory Smith, with the voices of Tommy Lee Jones, Frank Langella, Sarah Michelle Gellar and Christina Ricci

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them
programme.desc: British wizard Newt Scamander arrives in 1920s New York City with a bagful of magical creatures as part of a global study of fantastic beasts, but gets caught up in a conflict when some of the creatures in his care are accidentally released after an inadvertent switching of suitcases with a baker. With a strange, dark force terrorising the Big Apple, Newt needs to find some allies to help him round up the beasts, while saving his own skin in the meantime. Harry Potter prequel written for the screen by JK Rowling, starring Eddie Redmayne, with Katherine Waterston, Colin Farrell, Samantha Morton, Jon Voight, Dan Fogler and Carmen Ejogo

programme.title: Ella Enchanted
programme.desc: In a fantasy world where a fairy godmother endows each newborn with a special attribute, baby Ella is given the unwelcome gift of obedience. While growing up, she is magically compelled to do anything she is told to, and her stepmother takes great delight in forcing the girl to obey her every whim. So Ella sets out on a quest to find her fairy godmother and get her to take back her unwanted birthright. Fantasy adventure, starring Anne Hathaway, Hugh Dancy, Cary Elwes, Minnie Driver and Joanna Lumley

programme.title: Ride On
programme.desc: Lao Luo is a washed-up stuntman with a deformed horse called Red Hare, who he saved from euthanasia. The duo become overnight sensations when a fight with debt collectors goes viral. Writer/director Larry Yangs action drama, starring Jackie Chan, Liu Haocun and Kevin Guo. In Mandarin, with subtitles

programme.title: The Flintstones
programme.desc: Blue-collar caveman Fred Flintstone is promoted to an executive position at work and unwittingly becomes embroiled in an embezzlement scheme - thanks in no small part to his seductive new assistant. Live-action version of the cartoon comedy, starring John Goodman, Rick Moranis, Rosie ODonnell, Halle Berry and Elizabeth Taylor

programme.title: Look Whos Talking Now
programme.desc: A family takes in two pet dogs, a scruffy mongrel with discipline problems and a prim and proper pedigree poodle, whose personality clashes create all sorts of mayhem for the household. Comedy sequel, starring John Travolta and Kirstie Alley, plus the voices of Diane Keaton and Danny DeVito as the canine duo

programme.title: The Flintstones in Viva Rock Vegas
programme.desc: Young courting couples Fred and Wilma, and Barney and Betty are invited to stay at a luxury casino in the Stone Age gambling capital. Owner Chip Rockefeller is bent on stopping Fred proposing to wealthy Wilma, because he wants to marry her himself for the money and settle his debts. Family comedy prequel, with Mark Addy, Stephen Baldwin, Joan Collins, Alan Cumming, Kristen Johnston and Jane Krakowski

programme.title: Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire
programme.desc: The discovery of an ancient relic leads the Ghostbusters old and new to join forces to stop a second ice age. Supernatural comedy adventure sequel, starring Paul Rudd, Carrie Coon, Mckenna Grace and Finn Wolfhard

programme.title: The Cat in the Hat
programme.desc: Two bored youngsters are led on a series of zany misadventures when a manic moggy comes knocking at their door with a magical stovepipe hat on his head and mischief in mind. Comedy fantasy based on the childrens book by Dr Seuss, starring Mike Myers, Alec Baldwin, Dakota Fanning and Spencer Breslin

programme.title: Finding Neverland
programme.desc: Fact-based period drama based on the life of Peter Pan author JM Barrie. As a young-at-heart playwright, Barrie is uncomfortable with life in the critical spotlight. However, his friendship with four boys and their free-spirited widowed mother brings him the inspiration for his greatest work. Starring Johnny Depp, Kate Winslet, Dustin Hoffman, Julie Christie, Freddie Highmore and Kelly Macdonald

programme.title: The Spiderwick Chronicles
programme.desc: Life for identical twins Jared and Simon and their sister Mallory begins afresh when their mother inherits a spooky mansion. But after moving in, strange things begin to happen, and as the youngsters investigate, they discover a book that opens up a mysterious world of amazing supernatural creatures. Fantasy adventure, starring Freddie Highmore in a dual role alongside Sarah Bolger and Nick Nolte

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them
programme.desc: British wizard Newt Scamander arrives in 1920s New York City with a bagful of magical creatures as part of a global study of fantastic beasts, but gets caught up in a conflict when some of the creatures in his care are accidentally released after an inadvertent switching of suitcases with a baker. With a strange, dark force terrorising the Big Apple, Newt needs to find some allies to help him round up the beasts, while saving his own skin in the meantime. Harry Potter prequel written for the screen by JK Rowling, starring Eddie Redmayne, with Katherine Waterston, Colin Farrell, Samantha Morton, Jon Voight, Dan Fogler and Carmen Ejogo

programme.title: Fred Claus
programme.desc: Santas selfish brother Fred has been ostracised by his family for years, but when his crooked ways land him in jail, his brother comes along to bail him out on one condition - he must return to the family business and make toys for Christmas. But instead of cleaning up his act, Fred pushes Santas patience to the limit with his far from festive attitude. Comedy, starring Vince Vaughn, Paul Giamatti, Rachel Weisz, Miranda Richardson and Kevin Spacey

programme.title: Lemony Snickets A Series of Unfortunate Events
programme.desc: Three orphans are entrusted into the care of their sinister uncle, a master of disguise who intends to kill them for the family fortune. Quickly realising he is up to no good, the children flee, moving from one prospective guardian to the next - but their wily relative is never far behind. Comedy adventure based on the childrens books, starring Jim Carrey, Meryl Streep, Jude Law, Liam Aitken and Emily Browning, with Kara and Shelby Hoffman

programme.title: The Witches
programme.desc: A boy goes on holiday with his grandmother to a seaside hotel hosting a convention of witches, who have come together to hear their leaders plan to turn all the children in England into mice. When the chief hag discovers the young lad eavesdropping at their meeting, she decides to make him one of her first victims. Childrens fantasy directed by Nicolas Roeg, based on the book by Roald Dahl, and starring Anjelica Huston, Mai Zetterling, Jasen Fisher, Jane Horrocks, Rowan Atkinson and Brenda Blethyn

programme.title: Bean
programme.desc: The hapless fool is employed as a security guard for a British art gallery and is sent to Los Angeles to bring back a famous painting. Unfortunately, he finds himself mistaken for a renowned art professor and invited to make an important presentation. Mel Smiths British comedy, starring Rowan Atkinson, Burt Reynolds, Peter MacNicol, John Mills, Peter Capaldi and June Brown

programme.title: The Tiger Rising
programme.desc: When 12-year-old Rob Horton discovers a caged tiger in the woods near his home, his imagination runs wild and life begins to change in the most unexpected ways. With the help of a wise and mysterious maid, and the stubborn new girl in school, he navigates through childhood memories, heartache, and wondrous adventures. Family drama, starring Dennis Quaid, Queen Latifah, Christian Convery and Madalen Mills

programme.title: Friend or Foe
programme.desc: Two Second World War evacuees face a dilemma when they meet a German pilot who has been shot down. Family drama, starring John Bardon and Stacey Tendeter

programme.title: The Flintstones
programme.desc: Blue-collar caveman Fred Flintstone is promoted to an executive position at work and unwittingly becomes embroiled in an embezzlement scheme - thanks in no small part to his seductive new assistant. Live-action version of the cartoon comedy, starring John Goodman, Rick Moranis, Rosie ODonnell, Halle Berry and Elizabeth Taylor

programme.title: Smokey and the Bandit
programme.desc: A truck driver accepts a challenge to deliver a consignment of beer to a party. He claims he can make the 900-mile round trip in just 28 hours, but a pompous sheriff is determined to stop him in his tracks, not least because his prospective daughter-in-law has deserted his son and hitched a ride with the unlikely hero. Comedy, starring Burt Reynolds, Jackie Gleason, Sally Field and Jerry Reed

programme.title: Grease
programme.desc: Rebellious American teenager Danny falls for innocent Australian girl Sandy during the summer holidays, but when he later finds out she is a new student at his school, he risks losing her love by trying to act cool in front of his friends. Romantic musical set in the 1950s, starring John Travolta, Olivia Newton-John, Stockard Channing, Jeff Conaway, Didi Conn and Sid Caesar

programme.title: Saving Private Ryan
programme.desc: In the aftermath of the Normandy landings, a group of American soldiers scours the battlefields of France in search of a missing infantryman, who has been given compassionate leave to return home because his brothers have been killed in the conflict. Steven Spielbergs Oscar-winning Second World War drama, starring Tom Hanks, Tom Sizemore, Edward Burns, Matt Damon, Barry Pepper and Vin Diesel. It won five Academy Awards, including Best Cinematography, Best Film Editing, and Best Director. The film makers also took home a couple of Baftas for Best Sound and Best Special Effects

programme.title: The Bodyguard
programme.desc: Rachel Marron, a famous singer and actress is subjected to death threats by an obsessive fan and persuaded to hire a former secret service agent as her bodyguard. However, neither she or her new minder realise the effect they are about to have on each others lives. Romantic thriller directed by Mick Jackson, starring Kevin Costner, Whitney Houston, Gary Kemp and Bill Cobbs

programme.title: The Shawshank Redemption
programme.desc: A banker is wrongly jailed for his wifes murder and over the course of a life sentence he forms a close friendship with a fellow inmate. He also earns a position of trust as book-keeper to the corrupt prison governor - but makes an enemy of his benefactor as he tries to clear his name. Frank Darabonts drama, starring Tim Robbins, Morgan Freeman, Bob Gunton, William Sadler, Clancy Brown and Gil Bellows

programme.title: Robin Hood: Prince of Thieves
programme.desc: English nobleman Robin of Locksley returns home from fighting in the Crusades, only to discover that his father has been murdered and his lands seized, while the local people are living in fear under the tyrannical rule of the Sheriff of Nottingham. Branded an outlaw for his defiance, Robin and his Moorish travelling companion go into hiding in the forest, where they recruit a group of bandits to fight for justice, protect the downtrodden, and foil the Sheriffs plan to seize the throne while the king is away at war. Medieval action adventure, starring Kevin Costner, Alan Rickman, Morgan Freeman, Mary Elizabeth Mastrantonio, Christian Slater and Mike McShane

programme.title: Taxi Driver
programme.desc: An isolated, misanthropic New York cab driver becomes increasingly disturbed by the corruption he sees all around him. His desperate attempts to make connections with a political campaigner and a teenage prostitute, whom he feels compelled to save, seem doomed to failure, and he is gradually driven towards a brutal act of violence. Martin Scorseses drama, starring Robert De Niro, Jodie Foster, Cybill Shepherd and Harvey Keitel

programme.title: The Bridges at Toko-Ri
programme.desc: An American naval reserve pilot is called up for service in the Korean War, and must leave his family and civilian job as a lawyer. In command of a corps of naval pilots, he heads a bombing campaign on strategic Communist positions, but later comes to question the morality of the conflict. Adventure, starring William Holden, Grace Kelly, Fredric March and Mickey Rooney

programme.title: Pet Sematary
programme.desc: A father tries to resurrect his dead son by placing him in an enchanted burial ground but the plan backfires with devastating results. Horror, starring Dale Midkiff, Fred Gwynne and Denise Crosby, with a cameo appearance by author Stephen King, whose book provided the basis for the film

programme.title: Superman
programme.desc: A fledgling superhero crash-lands on Earth after evacuation from his home planet and is taken in by an elderly couple who raise him as their own. But with adolescence comes a greater understanding of his superhuman powers, leading to his rebirth as a crusader for justice and defender of the American way of life. Comic-strip adventure, with Christopher Reeve, Gene Hackman, Margot Kidder and Marlon Brando

programme.title: Superman II
programme.desc: The Man of Steel meets his match in the form of three fugitive villains from his home planet of Krypton. Flying down to Earth, the super-powered trio unleash a reign of terror in a bid to take over the world - but Superman is not there to stop them, having surrendered his powers to lead a normal life with his beloved Lois Lane. Comic-strip adventure sequel, with Christopher Reeve, Gene Hackman, Terence Stamp and Margot Kidder

programme.title: Raiders of the Lost Ark
programme.desc: Intrepid archaeologist Indiana Jones goes in search of the legendary Ark of the Covenant, a biblical artefact of devastating power. His quest leads him to Egypt, where the Nazis are plotting to use the Ark to further Hitlers plans for world domination - aided by Joness deceitful French rival. The first of five big-screen action adventures, starring Harrison Ford as Indy, with Karen Allen, Paul Freeman and John Rhys-Davies

programme.title: Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom
programme.desc: The intrepid archaeologist, with his young sidekick and a nightclub singer in tow, is stranded in India, where he takes on a mission to recover magical sacred stones from the hands of an evil cult engaged in human sacrifice and child slavery. Steven Spielbergs action adventure, starring Harrison Ford, Kate Capshaw, Ke Huy Quan and Amrish Puri

programme.title: Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade
programme.desc: The intrepid archaeologist sets out to find his estranged father, who has gone missing while searching for the Holy Grail. Once reunited, the duo team up to finish the task and locate the sacred relic before the Nazis get their hands on it. Action adventure sequel directed by Steven Spielberg, the third instalment in the successful franchise. Harrison Ford stars, alongside Sean Connery, Alison Doody, River Phoenix, Julian Glover and Denholm Elliott

programme.title: Wonder Woman
programme.desc: An Amazon princess who grows up in enchanted realm has her first encounter with the outside world during the First World War. American airman Steve Trevor crash lands on her isolated island home. Determined to bring the chaos sweeping the world to an end, she ventures onto the front line in an attempt to bring down an ancient and powerful evil force that is driving the human race towards destruction. Director Patty Jenkins blockbusting fantasy adventure, starring Gal Gadot, Chris Pine and David Thewlis

programme.title: Spider-Man
programme.desc: A clumsy teenager develops superhuman powers after a genetically engineered spider bites him. At first his fantastic skills delight him, but his elation is severely tempered by a family tragedy, prompting him to dedicate his talents to combating evil. However, he faces a baptism of fire in the form of crazed villain the Green Goblin. Comic-book superhero adventure, with Tobey Maguire, Kirsten Dunst, Willem Dafoe, James Franco and Rosemary Harris

programme.title: Spider-Man 2
programme.desc: Peter Parker continues his fight for justice, but unrequited love and personal worries take their toll and he is tempted to abandon his web-slinging alter ego. However, the arrival of deadly new bad guy Doctor Octopus plunges him into a race against time to save New York. Comic-book adventure sequel, with Tobey Maguire, Kirsten Dunst, Alfred Molina, James Franco and Rosemary Harris

programme.title: Superman
programme.desc: A fledgling superhero crash-lands on Earth after evacuation from his home planet and is taken in by an elderly couple who raise him as their own. But with adolescence comes a greater understanding of his superhuman powers, leading to his rebirth as a crusader for justice and defender of the American way of life. Comic-strip adventure, with Christopher Reeve, Gene Hackman, Margot Kidder and Marlon Brando

programme.title: Superman II
programme.desc: The Man of Steel meets his match in the form of three fugitive villains from his home planet of Krypton. Flying down to Earth, the super-powered trio unleash a reign of terror in a bid to take over the world - but Superman is not there to stop them, having surrendered his powers to lead a normal life with his beloved Lois Lane. Comic-strip adventure sequel, with Christopher Reeve, Gene Hackman, Terence Stamp and Margot Kidder

programme.title: Opus

Director Christopher Landons thriller, starring Meghann Fahy and Brandon Sklenar

programme.title: Mickey 17
programme.desc: In 2054, criminal Mickey Barnes signs up to be a worker who agrees to be reprinted every time he perishes. He flees Earth with friend and accomplice Timo on an interstellar mission to the remote colony of Niflheim, masterminded by Kenneth Marshall and his wife, Ylfa. The 17th iteration of Mickey is presumed dead after a close encounter with creatures on the planets surface, but is saved from a grim fate, and when he arrives back at base, Mickey meets his reprinted self. Director Bong Joon Hos sci-fi comedy, starring Robert Pattinson, Naomi Ackie, Mark Ruffalo, Toni Collette and Steven Yeun

programme.desc: A charitable and spirited Newport socialite in 1905 dreams of using her cash to start a foundation to help others in town. Romantic drama, starring Wes Brown and Ginna Claire Mason

programme.desc: Three reluctant adult siblings join their parents on a Christmas river cruise through Europe, each dealing with personal issues. Drama, starring Brandon Routh (Superman Returns), Jonathan Bennett and Eden Sher

programme.title: My Dead Friend Zoe
programme.desc: An Afghanistan veteran comes head to head with her Vietnam vet grandfather at the familys lake house. Comedy drama, starring Sonequa Martin-Green (The Walking Dead), Natalie Morales and Ed Harris

programme.title: Thieves Highway
programme.desc: After discovering a plot to haul stolen cattle in the middle of nowhere, a desperate and isolated lawman becomes the only person standing between lethal rustlers and a clear run to the border. Thriller, starring Lochlyn Munro

programme.title: Monolith
programme.desc: A disgraced journalist attempts to save her career by turning to investigative podcasting. She soon starts to wonder if a strange artefact is linked to an alien conspiracy, or whether she is losing her mind. Director Matt Veselys thriller, starring Lily Sullivan

programme.title: Gator Creek
programme.desc: A woman and her friends survive a plane crash, but discover something more dangerous lurking in the shallows of the Louisiana everglades. Horror thriller, starring Athena Strates and Madalena Aragao

programme.title: Lisa Frankenstein
programme.desc: A misunderstood teen embarks on a murderous journey with a reanimated Victorian man to find love, happiness and body parts. Comedy horror written by Diablo Cody, starring Kathryn Newton and Cole Sprouse

programme.title: Gothika
programme.desc: A psychiatrist wakes to find herself confined in the mental hospital where she once worked, accused of her husbands murder. Just when she thinks her situation could not get any worse, the spirit of a dead teenager begins to haunt her. Psychological horror, starring Halle Berry, Robert Downey Jr, Penelope Cruz and Bernard Hill

programme.title: Kong: Skull Island
programme.desc: Years after two enemy pilots land on a mysterious unchartered island in the Pacific, a team of scientists embark on a top-secret mission to the same region. Things soon descend into chaos when the local wildlife proves far from welcoming, and they must battle to escape from the domain of the mighty Kong. Action adventure, starring Tom Hiddleston, Samuel L Jackson and Brie Larson

programme.title: Battleship
programme.desc: A reckless slacker joins the Navy, hoping to win the respect of his girlfriends father, a stern admiral. He and his shipmates are put to the ultimate test as part of a force of vessels that must battle an invading fleet of powerful alien spaceships. Sci-fi adventure, starring Taylor Kitsch, Liam Neeson and Alexander Skarsgard

programme.title: Presence
programme.desc: A family become convinced they are not alone after moving into their new home in the suburbs. Steven Soderberghs horror thriller, starring Lucy Liu, Chris Sullivan, Callina Liang and Eddy Maday

programme.title: Companion
programme.desc: A billionaires death causes a bloody turn when an AI android built for human companionship goes haywire. Sci-fi horror, starring Jack Quaid, Sophie Thatcher Lukas Gage and Megan Suri

programme.title: The Shining
programme.desc: A writer takes a caretaking job at a remote mountain hotel. It has closed for the winter, and he has been hired to get the place ready for the next season. But evil spirits haunting its corridors destroy his sanity, causing the unhinged author to rampage through the hotel and terrorise his wife and young son. Stanley Kubricks horror, based on the Stephen King novel, with Jack Nicholson, Shelley Duvall, Danny Lloyd and Scatman Crothers

programme.title: Event Horizon
programme.desc: A deep-space salvage crew investigate mysterious events aboard a hi-tech spaceship, which suddenly reappeared in orbit around Neptune after going missing for seven years - but it is not long before they are exposed to terror beyond their wildest nightmares. Sci-fi horror, starring Laurence Fishburne, Sam Neill, Kathleen Quinlan, Joely Richardson and Sean Pertwee

programme.title: A Quiet Place
programme.desc: Two parents do whatever it takes to keep their children safe in a world full of creatures hunting every sound they hear. Nothing can be heard from the family hiding in silence, but all it takes is one noise and everything can go horrifically wrong. Horror, starring real-life husband-and-wife duo Emily Blunt and John Krasinski, who also directed

programme.title: Heart Eyes
programme.desc: When two co-workers survive a killer on Valentines Day, the two have to find out who it is. Comedy horror, starring Mason Gooding, Olivia Holt and Gigi Zumbado

programme.title: The Ring
programme.desc: A journalist investigates several teenage deaths, which are linked to a cursed videotape and the rumour that anyone who watches it will die a week later. Her growing obsession with the tape endangers herself and her family - and to avoid the predicted fate, she has just seven days to find out where the recording came from. Gore Verbinskis remake of the Japanese supernatural horror, starring Naomi Watts, Martin Henderson and Brian Cox

programme.title: The Ring 2
programme.desc: Journalist Rachel Keller and her son try to rebuild their shattered lives, moving from Seattle to Oregon and starting afresh. However, the vengeful spirit of Samara follows, and this time she is determined to destroy them. Sequel to the horror remake, starring Naomi Watts, Simon Baker and David Dorfman, and featuring a cameo appearance from Sissy Spacek

programme.title: Battleship
programme.desc: A reckless slacker joins the Navy, hoping to win the respect of his girlfriends father, a stern admiral. He and his shipmates are put to the ultimate test as part of a force of vessels that must battle an invading fleet of powerful alien spaceships. Sci-fi adventure, starring Taylor Kitsch, Liam Neeson and Alexander Skarsgard

A scientist learns the world is soon to face a global cataclysm that will wipe out the human race, but finds the US president has plans to secretly save a fraction of the population, leaving everyone else to die. A writer learns of this scheme, and as the world is devastated by earthquakes and volcanic eruptions, he tries to get his family to the last safe refuge. Disaster epic, starring John Cusack and Chiwetel Ejiofor

programme.title: The Invisible Man
programme.desc: An abused woman flees for her life and takes refuge with a family. It later appears that Cecilia Kasss ex has killed himself and shes due to inherit a fortune, but the fact he was experimenting with an invisibility suit makes her think hes come after her. Thriller, starring Elisabeth Moss, Oliver Jackson-Cohen and Harriet Dyer

programme.title: Pitch Black
programme.desc: A spaceship crashes on a desolate alien planet inhabited by nocturnal predators. The creatures fear of light seems to guarantee the survivors safety - but when an eclipse takes place, they face a desperate struggle to survive. Their only hope lies with a convicted murderer, who is equally at home in the darkness - but is far from trustworthy. Sci-fi horror, starring Vin Diesel and Radha Mitchell

programme.title: The Chronicles of Riddick
programme.desc: Fugitive Riddick evades capture by bounty hunters and steals their spacecraft, only to run into an even bigger threat - fanatical cult members on a sinister mission to kill or convert anyone who crosses their path as they seek galactic domination. Sci-fi adventure sequel, with Vin Diesel reprising his role from Pitch Black alongside Judi Dench, Alexa Davalos and Thandwie Newton.

programme.title: Riddick
programme.desc: A fugitive is left for dead by his treacherous followers on a dangerous world full of lethal predators. He lures bounty hunters to the planet in the hope of killing them and stealing their spacecraft, but finds himself forced to work with them against an attack by the monsters at the top of the food chain. Sci-fi thriller sequel, starring Vin Diesel and Katee Sackhoff

programme.title: Godzilla
programme.desc: A conspiracy theorists investigation of his wifes death in a nuclear reactor meltdown leads him and his soldier son into an encounter with underground creatures, which go on a deadly rampage across the world. The only hope for the human race may lie with another equally destructive giant monster. Thriller remake, starring Aaron Taylor-Johnson, Bryan Cranston and Ken Watanabe

programme.title: Superman III
programme.desc: The Man of Steel battles an evil tycoon, who has recruited a computer genius to aid his schemes for world domination. Together the villains hatch a plan to dispose of Superman once and for all - but instead of killing the superhero, they accidentally unveil his dark side. Comic-book adventure sequel, starring Christopher Reeve, Richard Pryor, Robert Vaughn and Margot Kidder

programme.title: Kill
programme.desc: Three brothers return to the remote woodland where they killed their abusive father, only to discover his shallow grave is now empty. Thriller, starring Daniel Portman, Brian Vernel and Paul Higgins

programme.title: Restless
programme.desc: A middle-aged empty nesters mundane life is upended when raucous new neighbours move in next door, unleashing potential danger and disruption. Writer/director Jed Harts thriller, starring Lyndsey Marshal and Declan Adamson

programme.title: To Catch a Killer
programme.desc: Eleanor is a talented but troubled young rookie detective wrestling with the demons of her past, when she is called to the scene of a brutal mass shooting - the work of a new and terrifying murderer. The police and FBI launch a nationwide manhunt, but are thwarted at every turn by the killers enigmatic, and unprecedented behaviour. Despite her lack of experience, Eleanor is drawn deeper into the case as she, and her newfound mentor, realise that she may be the only person, given her own tortured psyche, who can understand the mind of this singular killer. Thriller, starring Shailene Woodley, Ben Mendelsohn and Ralph Ineson

programme.title: Split
programme.desc: After being abducted by a kidnapper with multiple personalities, three young women are soon engaged in a fight for survival. Meanwhile, an oblivious psychiatrist tries to ease her patients fractured mind as a 24th character with apparent superhuman abilities attempts to dominate his body. M Night Shyamalans thriller, starring James McAvoy, Anya Taylor-Joy and Betty Buckley

programme.title: The Bikeriders
programme.desc: Truck driver Johnny is inspired to establish the Vandals motorcycle club in 1960s Chicago. He assembles a motley crew, including Brucie, Benny, Cal and Zipco. Exuberant outsider Kathy falls under Bennys spell, and they marry, but when the groom is the victim of a violent assault, Johnny exacts revenge, while Kathy fights for her husbands tormented soul. Drama, starring Tom Hardy, Jodie Comer and Austin Butler

programme.title: RocknRolla
programme.desc: A Russian mob boss sets up a profitable real-estate scam in London and soon every criminal in the city is after their share. The gangsters accountant hires a trio of crooks to take his bosss millions, while a rock star with a penchant for faking his own death causes further mayhem by stealing a valuable painting. Guy Ritchies crime comedy, starring Gerard Butler, Tom Wilkinson and Thandie Newton

programme.title: Murder by Numbers
programme.desc: Two teenagers murder a random victim for their own amusement, convinced nobody will ever suspect them of committing such a senseless crime, and ensure all the evidence points to a drug dealer. However, they reckon without a suspicious and determined detective and her partner. Thriller, starring Sandra Bullock, Ryan Gosling and Michael Pitt

programme.title: Oceans 8
programme.desc: Following in the footsteps of brother Danny, light-fingered Debbie Ocean plans to steal the Toussaint, a $150million necklace from Vogues Met Gala, with the help of a famous actress. Crime caper, starring Sandra Bullock, Cate Blanchett, Anne Hathaway and Mindy Kaling

programme.title: Snatch
programme.desc: An unlicensed boxing promoter and his dim-witted sidekick convince a bare-knuckle champion to step in for their injured fighter, but find themselves drawn into a match-fixing racket. Meanwhile, the loot from a diamond heist goes missing, leading to a bloody conflict between Russian gangsters and a Jewish mob. Guy Ritchies comedy drama, with Jason Statham, Brad Pitt, Benicio Del Toro and Stephen Graham

programme.title: True Romance
programme.desc: A shy clerk marries a hooker and kills her pimp, and together they go on the run to Los Angeles with $5million of cocaine they plan to sell. However, the drugs belong to the Mob and hitmen are soon on their trail. Tony Scotts thriller, written by Quentin Tarantino and starring Christian Slater, Patricia Arquette, Dennis Hopper, Gary Oldman, Val Kilmer, Brad Pitt and Christopher Walken

programme.title: Three Days of the Condor
programme.desc: A bookish CIA researcher returns to his field office to find all his colleagues have been murdered in his absence. When he tries to uncover the truth, he also ends up targeted for assassination by his own agency, and is forced to go on the run to discover the reasons why. Sydney Pollacks thriller, starring Robert Redford, Faye Dunaway, Cliff Robertson and Max von Sydow

programme.title: The Godfather Part II
programme.desc: Mafia don Michael Corleone sets out to clinch a make-or-break deal with an ageing gangster - but his plans are blown apart by a traitor within the family. Michaels story is intercut with flashback sequences chronicling the early life of his father Vito as he makes the shift from immigrant grocery-store clerk to Mob kingpin. Francis Ford Coppolas Oscar-winning crime drama sequel, with Al Pacino, Robert De Niro, Robert Duvall, Diane Keaton, Talia Shire, John Cazale and Lee Strasberg

Francis Ford Coppolas gangster drama, starring Marlon Brando, Al Pacino, James Caan, John Cazale, Talia Shire, Robert Duvall and Diane Keaton

Francis Ford Coppolas Oscar-winning crime drama sequel, with Al Pacino, Robert De Niro, Robert Duvall, Diane Keaton, Talia Shire, John Cazale and Lee Strasberg

programme.desc: Twenty years after ordering the murder of his brother, ageing don Michael Corleone is close to fulfilling his dream of severing his familys Mafia ties and gaining legitimacy, but vengeful enemies and the actions of his hot-headed nephew soon draw him back into a life of crime. Francis Ford Coppolas crime drama sequel, starring Al Pacino, Andy Garcia, Diane Keaton, Talia Shire, Eli Wallach and Bridget Fonda

programme.title: Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: The eccentric detective and his confidant Dr Watson investigate the apparent resurrection of a criminal mastermind with links to the occult, who is carrying out a series of seemingly magical murders. The case is complicated by the reappearance of Holmes duplicitous old flame Irene Adler. Action thriller, starring Robert Downey Jr, Jude Law, Rachel McAdams, Mark Strong and Eddie Marsan

programme.title: Sherlock Holmes: A Game of Shadows
programme.desc: The detective investigates a series of seemingly unconnected crimes all around the world, and becomes convinced one man is behind them all - the elusive Professor Moriarty. He sets forth on an international journey to bring the evil mastermind to justice, but finds he is dealing with a foe who is his intellectual equal. Action thriller sequel, starring Robert Downey Jr, Jude Law, Noomi Rapace and Jared Harris

programme.title: Clear and Present Danger
programme.desc: A CIA analyst gets caught up in the Colombian drug trade while trying to track down terrorists responsible for the murder of a close friend of the US president - but his investigations point to illegal activity and corruption at the very top of government. Action thriller, based on Tom Clancys novel, with Harrison Ford reprising his role from Patriot Games alongside Willem Dafoe, Anne Archer and James Earl Jones

programme.title: To Catch a Thief
programme.desc: A retired cat burglar becomes the prime suspect for a series of robberies carried out in his own distinctive style, and sets out to clear his name by catching the copycat crook responsible. His quest takes him to the Cote dAzur, where he encounters the demure daughter of a wealthy holiday-maker, and before long the two are drawn together. Alfred Hitchcocks romantic mystery, starring Cary Grant, Grace Kelly and Jessie Royce Landis

programme.desc: Jack auditions to be a dancer for guest star Janet Jackson, but Karen has other ideas. Meanwhile, a broken-hearted Grace becomes addicted to attending Alcoholics Anonymous meetings and causes friction between Will and Vince

programme.desc: Will visits a gay TV station to give suggestions on policy, unaware Jack has just joined the company as an executive. Meanwhile, Grace is lured to an Alcoholics Anonymous meeting by the promise of free food - and bumps into Val. Guest starring Molly Shannon, with Eric McCormack and Debra Messing

programme.title: Will and Grace
programme.desc: Grace meets a new neighbour in the lift and invites him to a dinner party, but soon discovers he is not the ideal guest. Meanwhile, Jack falls out with his workmates, angry with them for teasing him about owning a Cher doll. Stephen Tobolowsky (Glee) guest stars

programme.title: Sex and the City
programme.desc: Carrie can hardly contain herself as her first official date with Jack Berger approaches, and Samantha complains about her districts trendy image - until a new neighbour alters her view. Charlotte is disappointed by Harrys refusal to marry outside the Jewish faith and Miranda realises she has invested more in her relationship with Steve than she planned. Sarah Jessica Parker, Kristin Davis, Kim Cattrall and Cynthia Nixon star

programme.title: Sex and the City
programme.desc: Carrie and Berger enjoy some steamy public foreplay, Charlotte considers converting to Judaism and Mirandas personal video recorder becomes her new boyfriend. Meanwhile, Samantha introduces the girls to a raw food restaurant that boasts a dishy waiter. Jason Lewis joins the cast

programme.title: Sex and the City
programme.desc: Samanthas lover is dismissed after they are caught in a compromising position, and Miranda sends out confusing signals to Steve. Charlotte is shocked by the changes she will need to make to convert to Judaism, while Carrie feels uneasy when Berger questions her about past relationships

programme.title: Sex and the City
programme.desc: Jerry drops a bombshell after moving his sexual role-playing with Samantha to another level. Charlotte takes to her new religion with gusto, but is upset when Harry fails to match her enthusiasm. Meanwhile, Miranda misinterprets her dates stomach troubles after Berger gives her relationship advice

programme.title: Sex and the City
programme.desc: Samantha visits Brooklyn to see Jerrys trouser-dropping performance in a play, and Carrie realises she may have behaved tactlessly by buying Berger a designer shirt. Charlotte is dumped by Harry and resolves to stay single, while Miranda half-heartedly attempts to get back with Steve by making cupcakes for his girlfriend. American comedy, starring Sarah Jessica Parker, Kristin Davis, Cynthia Nixon and Kim Cattrall

programme.title: Community
programme.desc: Annie directs a play for children warning them of the dangers of drugs, but Pierce lets his starring role go to his head

programme.title: Community

programme.title: Community

programme.desc: Michael nervously awaits Hollys return from her holiday, hoping to discover if she got engaged to AJ - but ends up feeling more confused than ever. Pam encourages her co-workers to share their New Years resolutions. Comedy, starring Steve Carell

programme.desc: Andy hopes to find prospective paper buyers by hosting a business seminar, and one attendee make Jim uncomfortable. Michael is elated to learn that Holly is single, and Erin is frustrated by her inability to beat Gabe at an online game

Comedy, starring Steve Carell

programme.title: The Office (US)
programme.desc: Michael and Hollys public displays of affection begin to irritate their co-workers. A champagne lunch leaves Pam and Jim the worse for wear and Andy struggles to keep his jealousy in check when Gabe prepares a Valentines Day surprise for Erin. Comedy, starring Steve Carell

programme.desc: A stand-up performance by the comedian, featuring off-beat stories, unusual anecdotes and bizarre journeys through modern-day womanhood

programme.title: Entourage

Eric offers to represent two writers of an indie film script, and Drama remains in contact with Jacqueline. Comedy, starring Adrian Grenier and Kevin Connolly

programme.title: Entourage

programme.title: Life After People
programme.desc: The fate of homes in a world without people, where suburbs turn into mass infernos, and a famous castle topples, owing to a hidden flaw

programme.title: Prison Chronicles
programme.desc: The Hanoi Hilton, an American PoW prison of the Vietnam War located in the city of Hanoi. Captives included future United States Senator John McCain, a group of airmen who invented a secret communication code and Jerimiah Denton, who sneaked messages home on live TV

programme.title: Prison Chronicles
programme.desc: The Sing Sing Correctional Facility, situated north of New York City and regarded as one of the countrys most notorious prisons. There have been several break-out attempts over the years

programme.title: Colosseum
programme.desc: Drama-documentary that uses the Colosseum to tell the thrilling story of the rise and fall of the Roman Empire. As the Roman Empire continued to expand, so did the diversity of exotic beasts brought back to entertain the Colosseum crowds. Over one million animals were slaughtered in the arena by trained beast masters, none more famous than Carpophorus

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts question what probes on Mars may have found over the past 40 years, asking if Nasa could be hiding proof of life on the Red Planet from the public

programme.title: Ancient Aliens: The Ultimate Evidence
programme.sub-title: Aliens and the Creation of Man
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos takes an in-depth look at more extra-terrestrial mysteries, joining forces with theorists to consider whether unexplained advances in human evolution can be attributed to alien architects

programme.title: Secrets of the Lost Ark
programme.desc: The Ark of the Covenant is said to have been forged by God with gold and holy heavenly fire imbued with the power of God that makes it indestructible. It is also believed to possess a mythical power. The team members trace the Arks destructive path to uncover the truth behind its elusive journey

programme.title: Caesars Doomsday War
programme.desc: Part two of two. Julius Caesars relentless pursuit of power positioned him against a mighty rebel force that fought the infamous Roman general at his own game. Here, archaeologists investigate the truth behind key moments that took Caesar to the brink of defeat

programme.title: Weeks of War
programme.desc: A look at what it was really like to live and survive during one of the most devastating conflicts the world has ever seen

programme.title: WWIIs Most Daring Raids
programme.desc: Detailing how an elite group of British paratroopers managed to launch a midnight raid in order to capture Hitlers unusual radar equipment

programme.title: Greatest Escapes of WWII
programme.desc: A look at some of the most incredible escapes of the conflict, as captured soldiers, sailors and airmen on both sides dared the impossible to win their freedom. This episode focuses on Hitlers last soldier in America who defied the FBI for 40 years, the prisoners who revealed the secrets of the death camps and the merciless Nazi who almost got away

programme.title: The UnBelievable with Dan Aykroyd

programme.title: Strangest Things
programme.sub-title: The Pyramid Tool Kit, the Killer Foot Machine and the Lost Head
programme.desc: One hundred and fifty years ago a strange set of objects were found in the Great Pyramid in Giza. A piece of cedar wood with regular marks etched along its length, a two-pronged bronze hook with two pins sticking into it, and a baseball-sized sphere made of granite

programme.title: What on Earth?
programme.desc: Documentary series focusing on six unfathomable mysteries - from a gigantic tsunami that never hits land, to a sinister blood-red lake in war-torn Baghdad

programme.title: History of Weapons
programme.desc: The connection between the development of military devices and the aftermath of their usage - dynamics that shaped several millennia of human fate. programme.title: Ancient Aliens

programme.title: Digging Up Britains Past
programme.desc: Helen Skelton and Alex Langlands explore the history of Stonehenge, examining the stones that make up the structure, their acoustic properties, and how they were transported 120 miles from their origins in Salisbury Plain to form the circle. programme.title: Weird Britain
programme.sub-title: Scotland: The Search for the Loch Ness Monster
programme.desc: Andy McGrath joins a team of Nessie experts and volunteers to carry out the biggest search for the Loch Ness Monster in 50 years, utilising the latest hi-tech equipment

programme.title: Britains Most Historic Towns
programme.desc: Alice Roberts explores Edinburgh and its role in the union between England and Scotland. She discovers how the famous case of Burke and Hares bodysnatching influenced British medical law, and visits the Royal Bank of Scotland, where she uncovers evidence of the worlds first overdraft. Plus, the role played by Henry Dundas, whose statue stands in St Andrews Square, in the continuation of the slave trade

programme.title: Britains Most Historic Towns
programme.desc: Professor Alice Roberts is in Glasgow to investigate the impact of steam power on Britains major towns in the 18th and 19th centuries. She also learns about the arrival of migrant workers in the city and how the insanitary conditions in which they lived, which made Glasgow both a hotbed of disease and a place of great medical advancement. Aerial archaeologist Ben Robinson flies his drone over Loch Katrine as he tells the story of how Victorian engineers overcame geographical barriers to bring fresh drinking water to the workers of Glasgow

programme.title: River Hunters
programme.desc: River detectorist Beau Ouimette and presenter and keen swimmer Rick Edwards go in search of evidence of the clashing Scottish clans embroiled in the civil war that raged across the British Isles in the 17th century. Fights erupted during this period between the Royalists supporting the King and the Covenanters wanting more power for church and state. Starting on the River Lochy, situated in the shadow of Ben Nevis, the pair hunt for evidence of the 1645 Battle of Inverlochy - a pivotal fight that saw the Royalist army launch a surprise attack against the ill-prepared Covenanters

programme.title: River Hunters
programme.desc: Rick Edwards and Beau Ouimette look for evidence of Roman life in Scotland, heading to Ardoch Fort in Perthshire, on the east bank of the River Knaik. It spans over eight and a half acres and was built under Agricola around 80AD on the east bank of the River Knaik. The fort occupied a key strategic route through Perthshire and into north-east Scotland from the First to Third centuries

programme.title: Secrets of Great British Castles
programme.desc: Perched high on a volcanic crag overlooking the River Forth, Stirling has long been one of the most strategically important castles in Britain. Guarding the gateway to the Highlands, its battle-scarred walls have witnessed savagery and chivalry, intrigue, alchemy, adultery and murder. With the aid of location filming, aerial shots and dramatic reconstructions, Dan Jones examines the history of this stronghold and relates the stories of some of the powerful characters who have owned it over the centuries

programme.title: Secrets of Great British Castles
programme.desc: Dan Jones explores the turbulent history of six of Britains most famous castles, his journey commencing with a visit to Edinburgh Castle. A popular tourist attraction to this day, Dan explores the history of this famous stronghold that began as an Iron Age battle base and remains a military facility to this day, and was the target of the worlds first aerial bombing

programme.title: After Braveheart
programme.desc: The first in a two-part docu-drama revealing the historical events that followed those portrayed in the 1995 film Braveheart, in which Scottish knight William Wallace led the Scots in a revolt against English rule. The programme reveals how Edward Bruce, the brother of King Robert the Bruce, tried to unite the Celtic nations and drive the English out of Ireland in 1315

programme.title: After Braveheart
programme.desc: The concluding part of the docu-drama revealing the historical events that followed those portrayed in the 1995 film Braveheart, in which William Wallace led the Scots in a revolt against English rule

programme.title: Ancient Aliens

programme.title: Craig Charles: UFO Conspiracies

programme.title: Valley of Flood and Fire

programme.title: Valley of Flood and Fire
programme.desc: As the dry season takes hold in Luangwa Valley, lagoons dry up and verdant grasslands gradually turn to dust. Animals must take advantage while they can

programme.title: Valley of Flood and Fire
programme.desc: The documentary about the Luangwa Valley considers how the life of every animal is linked to the vastly different seasons - the wet and the dry

programme.title: Wild Canary Islands
programme.desc: A look into the wildlife on the Canary Islands and the astonishing ecosystems where new opportunities arose for species when rocks engulfed by flames emerged from the ocean

programme.title: Great Lakes Wild

programme.title: Great Lakes Wild

programme.title: Great Lakes Wild
programme.desc: It is a conundrum of conservation. Where animals and humans co-exist, how do you stop a bad reputation from pushing a species towards extinction?

programme.title: Weird, Wild and Wonderful
programme.desc: The natural world is filled with colourful, quaint and quirky characters. It may look crazy, but there are good reasons life got this way. This documentary reveals how, when the name of the game is survival, nothing is too outrageous

programme.title: Strange Creatures
programme.desc: The weirdest wildlife wonders of the natural world, including a very strange plant, as well as four animals known for their bad toilet etiquette

programme.title: Strange Creatures

programme.title: Strange Creatures

programme.title: David Attenboroughs First Life
programme.desc: In the first of a two-part documentary, the naturalist explores the origins of life on Earth. Beginning the journey near his childhood home in Charnwood Forest, Leicestershire, he learns how a fossil discovery transformed scientists understanding of the evolution of complex organisms, and in Newfoundland and Australia he reveals the earliest kinds of animal to exist on the planet. With the help of cutting-edge technology and visual effects, the programme brings the creatures to life, demonstrating how they survived

programme.title: David Attenboroughs First Life
programme.desc: In the conclusion of the two-part documentary, the naturalist travels to Burgess Shale in Canadas Rocky Mountains, where he explores how evolution gained pace once creatures developed mouths and mobility. In Scotland, he reveals that one of the smallest fossils found holds the secret to how animals began surviving on dry land, and explains the bloom of life during the oxygen-rich Carboniferous period

programme.desc: Diarmuid Ó Drisceoil nears the end of his journey following in the footsteps of Annraoí Ó Liathain along the Munster River Blackwater. At the turn of the river, where it becomes tidal at Cappaquinn, Diarmuid explains the influence of the Anglo Irish along this stretch of the river, the historic maritime traffic, the salmon fishing, as well as the probable real name for the river, visiting poet Thomas McCarthy as his journey culminates at the historic port and walled town of Youghal where the river meets the sea

programme.title: Gael-Linn ag 70
programme.desc: The 70th anniversary of the foundation of Gael-Linn, one of the most innovative organisations in late 20th-century Ireland. A transforming organisation that ensured that the Irish language, its people and its culture would have a home in modern Ireland. Performers include Moya Brennan, Mairead Ní Mhaonaigh, Liam Ó Maonlaí, Colm Mac Con Iomaire and Rossa Ó Snodaigh, Maighread and Tríona Ní Dhomhnaill, Mary Bergin and Macdara Ó Faoláin, IMLÉ le Ríona Sally Hartman, Sarah Ghriallais, Muintir Uí Bheaglaoich, Gráinne Holland, Niamh Farrell, and Binneas

programme.title: Athbheatha: Colmcille Ildánach
programme.desc: Artworks commissioned in the visual arts, music and literature by the RIA with the support of the Department of Foreign Affairs as part of its multi-faceted commemoration of the 1,500th anniversary of Colmcilles birth. This programme meets the artists involved in each piece and finds out the inspiration and artistry behind these unique works of art. Contributors include caligrapher Timothy O Neill, glass artist Roisín de Buitlear, poets Biddy Jenkinson, Sandy Nic Dhòmhnaill Jones, Simon Ó Faoláin, writer Proinsias Mac a Bhaird and musicians Zoe Conway, Julie Fowlis, Éamonn Doorley and John McIntyre

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade and comedian Ellie Taylor head to the Spanish capital for a two-day break, following an itinerary rich in art, history, histrionics and ham. The pair go on a guided tour in which they view masterpieces by Bosch, Velasquez, Picasso and Dali, before they attend a ham-carving workshop and a sample a five-course tasting menu, of which four courses are pork or ham, including a tartare dish. They also take in a lively boating lake, a circus church and a grisly tour of the Spanish Inquisition

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore the nations love affair with beer and cider, revealing how at one time it was safer to drink ale than water. The duo are also given a chance to gain hands-on brewing experience at a cider festival

programme.title: Mortimer and Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Paul Whitehouse and Bob Mortimer head to Norfolk, where they attempt to ensnare a large pike - a fish that has eluded them on their trips so far. As they arrive and get their gear together, Bob introduces Paul to the surprisingly varied contents of his car boot, much to Pauls amusement. They gather their equipment and find a decent spot that should give them plenty of chances to catch and make camp for the day. They end their trip with a visit to a local pub, where Bob reveals a hidden trick

programme.title: Mortimer and Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Paul and Bob fish for brown trout on the river Test in Hampshire, using a Victorian fly-casting technique pioneered in the area as well as an authentic 19th-century rod. The Mayflies are hatching, and the famously short-lived insects inspire some thoughts on the ephemeral nature of life, and what they would do if they only had 24 hours left

programme.title: Guy Martins Battle of Britain
programme.desc: Part two of two. Guys training ramps up at the UKs only aerial combat school, where he must master dogfighting at 200mph, handling extreme g-force, and flying upside down. He enlists the help of the Parachute Regiment for a unique experiment demonstrating the firepower of Second World War aircraft machine guns, before being allowed behind the joystick of the worlds only two-seater Hawker Hurricane to face a Messerschmitt 109 in the skies over Kent

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Freddie Flintoff heads to Iceland to compete in the worlds maddest motorsport, while Paddy McGuinness gets to grips with the latest Toyota Supra. Chris Harris investigates the story of the Lotus 79, arguably the most beautiful F1 car of all time

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Paddy McGuiness, Chris Harris and Freddie Flintoff go on a road trip in a trio of affordable second-hand convertibles. Chris puts the Ariel Atom through its paces and Freddie goes bungee jumping off a dam in an old Rover

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: US host Sean Kelly oversees UK bidders in Lewes, East Sussex, where a vehicle sends bids sky high, John has spotted treasure, and Scotty and Dan play dirty

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: US host Sean Kelly oversees UK bidders battling to win potential treasures found in storage containers, lock-ups and garages in Ipswich

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: US host Sean Kelly oversees UK bidders battling to win potential treasures found in storage containers, lock-ups and garages in Kent

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers celebrate quality produce that needs to be cooked with the respect it deserves, as they continue their culinary journey through time. The duo argue that, while convenience food serves a purpose, only the best ingredients and perfect cooking can produce something truly delicious

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore the nations love affair with beer and cider, revealing how at one time it was safer to drink ale than water. The duo are also given a chance to gain hands-on brewing experience at a cider festival

programme.title: Ireland with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Part one of two. Simon explores the history of both the Republic of Ireland and Northern Ireland and examines the rich culture and troubled past of the island. Simon arrives by ferry in Co Wexford and travels along the coast, joining the thousands who try to climb the sacred mountain of Croagh Patrick. He crosses the border to visit Crom Castle and Londonderry, before journeying to the northernmost point at Malin Head

programme.title: Ireland with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Part two of two. The second leg of Simons journey begins at the Giants Causeway, before visiting a kelp farm on Rathlin Island. He heads to the Dark Hedges in Co Antrim, one of the filming locations from Game of Thrones, and visits Belfast for the July 12 parades, discovering how the event has divided the city. He also learns more about Oliver Cromwells influence on Ireland, attends the Gaze film festival, and meets monkeys at an animal sanctuary in the Wicklow mountains

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade is joined by comedian Joe Wilkinson for a two-day break in Polands second city Krakow, beginning by attending a baking workshop, before heading to a salt mine to marvel at the worlds largest underground chapel. They also drive to Nowa Huta, a showcase suburb of socialist realism, where they end up in an authentic communist-era apartment - with obligatory vodka and pickles. After a lunch of pierogi dumplings, they take part in a stained glass workshop at the centre of Krakows art nouveau movement

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Rebel Wilson joins Richard Ayoade on a rapid-fire tour of the Italian city, taking in as much as they can in just two days. They race past iconic works of art including Botticellis Venus and Michelangelos David, take in some street art, go on a rafting trip down the River Arno, climb to the top of the citys cathedral and dine on a traditional tripe sandwich

programme.title: James May at the Edge of Space
programme.desc: James undergoes rigorous training at a US Air Force base in California before boarding a U-2 spy plane for a flight that will take him 70,000ft above Earth. Along the way he has to learn how to eject from his cockpit in an emergency, how to survive the 13-mile fall back to terra firma and how to wear a space suit worth $250,000

programme.desc: Packages of cocaine are found concealed in the chassis of a bus, officers receive a tip-off about a vehicle loaded with cartel cash, and a magician comes under scrutiny

programme.desc: The motorcycle racer and lorry mechanic attempts, with the aid of slipstreaming, to break the British record for outright speed on a bicycle - 110mph. Guy recruits a team comprising a truck racer, a bike builder and a design engineer to prepare for the feat, and undergoes a training regime with double Olympic cycling gold medallist Laura Trott before heading to Pendine Sands on the shores of Carmarthen Bay for his challenge

programme.title: Speed with Guy Martin
programme.desc: For his second adrenaline-fuelled challenge, the racer tries to set the world record for riding a motorcycle on water. With the help of a Cambridge professor and a team of marine engineers, he attempts the feat at Bala Lake in Snowdonia, with extra fittings on his bike that should enable it to skim across the surface. Crashing is inevitable, so Guy endures a rigorous training schedule to prepare himself for the task

programme.desc: Customs and Border Protection officers think they have spotted a trend when they seize drugs from behind the dashboards of two cars. A Mexican woman asks officers for protection

programme.desc: Quinnan and Boulton tackle the strange case of a drugged dog and a shady hippy, while Hollis defends the reputation of Sun Hill in a pub quiz. Police drama, starring Andrew Paul, Russell Boulter and Jeff Stewart

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Santini and Page investigate when a young girl is knocked down in a hit-and-run incident. With the child recovering in hospital, Santini discovers she is a big fan of Arsenal, and in particular Emmanuel Petit. Santini has a contact in the sports promotion industry and boasts that he can make a dream come true for the youngster by getting Petit to visit, but Page isnt sure he can deliver. Meanwhile, Stamp has the job of organising the relief Christmas party, and finds a very cheap supplier for the booze, until he gets caught up in the middle of a Customs raid. Michael Higgs stars, with a guest appearance by former soccer star Emmanuel Petit

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: A Christian Scientist couple refuse medicine for their newborn baby, leaving Sister Julienne questioning the nature of absolute faith. However, the case becomes more complicated when the parents are accused of harming their child. Barbara uses her initiative to communicate with a pregnant Sylheti woman who cannot speak English, although using the patients young son to translate provides new problems. Sister Mary Cynthia returns to Nonnatus House and a woman catches handyman Freds eye

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: A diabetic teenager faces a tough time after falling pregnant, a situation complicated by her boyfriends criminal past. Nurse Crane offers what support she can - but the girls life is endangered when the young lovers go on the run.
