programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Why Does Norman Clegg Buy Ladies Elastic Stockings?
programme.desc: Howard asks a reluctant Clegg to deliver a message to Marina at her place of employment. Meanwhile, Seymour goes in search of oil, but manages to drill through a water main. Comedy, starring Peter Sallis and Michael Aldridge

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Seymour takes it upon himself to supervise repairs to a boat, and together with Clegg tries to persuade Compo to take up canoeing to improve his physique. Comedy, starring Michael Aldridge, Peter Sallis and Bill Owen

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: While trying a man with an emotional age of 13 for murder, Deed causes outrage among his fellow judges by delving into a fraud case involving two solicitors. As they, Sir Ian Rochester and even his ex-father-in-law urge him not to get involved, Deed pushes harder for the truth

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Brian finds the library card of cold case victim Dr Richard Symes, leading the team to reinvestigate the death of the professor, who perished after falling from the roof of his college three years previously. Sandra and Gerry interview Symes widow, who believes principal Jeremy Ventham drove her husband to suicide following a conflict over teaching methods. Crime drama, starring Alun Armstrong and Amanda Redman

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.sub-title: In the Sight of the Lord: Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. A fourth body is discovered, dispatched with the killers trademark nail through the head. Boyds investigation leads him back to the Lindfield Regiment, and to a mysterious woman the latest victim was attempting to track down. In doing so, he uncovers a long-buried story of a gang rape that led to pregnancy and suicide. Trevor Eve and Sue Johnston star

programme.title: Hamish Macbeth
programme.desc: Unambitious PC Hamish Macbeths rural beat is rocked by two bizarre mysteries - the theft of salt from the local shop and the disappearance of a well-known bully - suggesting sinister forces could be at work. First episode of the comedy drama set against the backdrop of a sleepy Highland village, starring Robert Carlyle, Ralph Riach and Valerie Gogan

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Victor Meldrew finds himself forced into early retirement, but is determined not to end up on the scrapheap, pouring scorn on the modern world and driving everybody crazy in the process. Richard Wilson stars in the first-ever episode as misery guts Meldrew, with Annette Crosbie as his long-suffering wife. From 1990

programme.title: Terry and June
programme.desc: The couple decide to have a summer barbecue - but things fail to go according to plan. Suburban sitcom, starring Terry Scott and June Whitfield

programme.title: The Chelsea Detective
programme.desc: Art gallery manager Chris Milton-Elwes is found dead following a robbery at the opening exhibition of The Chaban Gallery

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Del-Boy embarks on a new romance with Raquel, an actress he meets through a computer dating agency, while Rodney takes Nervous Nerys out for a burn in the three-wheeler - but as ever with the Peckham twosome, nothing goes quite according to plan. Christmas special from 1988, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Tessa Peake-Jones

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del seizes a rare opportunity to make a quick profit and bring Trotters Independent Traders into the hi-tech world of satellite communications. Meanwhile, Rodney plunges to the depths of despair as his marriage continues to deteriorate. Comedy, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: An audition gives Raquel the chance of a lifetime - and perhaps more importantly, an excuse to get out of Nelson Mandela House. Del-Boy is as excited as she is about the prospect, but only because he sees himself as the man behind her rapid rise to stardom. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Tessa Peake-Jones

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del becomes a showbiz entrepreneur after discovering a sensational Tom Jones-style singer at a local club. Teaming him up with Raquel, he wastes no time in booking the duo at a birthday party for the elderly mother of a local hoodlum - but it soon becomes clear his new signing is not everything he is cracked up to be. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Tessa Peake-Jones, with a guest appearance by Philip Pope

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del is invited to a school reunion at the Nags Head organised by old adversary Roy Slater (Jim Broadbent), who has recently been released from prison and claims to have turned over a new leaf. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Tessa Peake-Jones

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: He Aint Heavy, Hes My Uncle
programme.desc: Uncle Albert falls victim to muggers, so Del-Boy resolves to take the law into his own hands, while Rodney becomes a director in Trotters Independent Traders - and his first job is to give the car a good clean. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: Three Men, a Woman and a Baby
programme.desc: Rodney and Albert begin to worry the flat will get overcrowded as the birth of Del-Boy Jr approaches, while Del feels well prepared for fatherhood thanks to a stint at antenatal classes with Raquel. Starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst

programme.title: The Vicar of Dibley
programme.desc: It is 10 years since Geraldine Granger became the first female vicar of Dibley, and the villagers are keen to celebrate the anniversary with a party. The carol-writing competition produces some of the worst rhyming couplets ever committed to paper, the men decide a stripper would go down a treat and the unexpected arrival of a scantily clad supermodel only complicates proceedings. Festive special from 2004, guest starring Rachel Hunter

programme.title: Gavin and Stacey
programme.desc: The Shipmans travel to Wales to spend Christmas with the Wests, but for Gavin and Stacey, parenthood continues to present them with several challenges, their baby now being 10. Smithy also continues to commit to his fatherly role, making the journey to Barry at weekends and every second Wednesday to see 12-year-old Neil the Baby. Nessa has adopted her own style of mothering, while Pam, Mick and Gwen have become the epitome of doting grandparents. On Christmas Eve, Dawn makes a shocking discovery about Pete that jeopardises their marriage - again - while a visit to the pub becomes an eye-opener in more ways than one. Festive edition from 2019. starring Mathew Horne, Joanna Page, James Corden and Ruth Jones

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: Three Men, a Woman and a Baby
programme.desc: Rodney and Albert begin to worry the flat will get overcrowded as the birth of Del-Boy Jr approaches, while Del feels well prepared for fatherhood thanks to a stint at antenatal classes with Raquel. Starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst

programme.title: The Cockfields
programme.desc: Simon and Ray head to the nursing home to see Rose, while Sue and Esther mind Sues stall at the Craft Fayre together

programme.title: The Cockfields
programme.desc: Simon goes on a bike ride with Larry while Esther spends the day with Sue, fielding questions about the wedding. Esther helps David get ready for his date

programme.title: The Cockfields
programme.desc: Ray teaches David and Simon how to bowl, while Sue tries to plan for Christmas. Esthers conversation with Lyn leads to a drastic decision

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: A festive special of John Sullivans sitcom from 2006. Jed, Elgin and Bryan become convinced a mythical creature is stalking Winterdown Farm, and Llewellyn accuses the Boyces dog of seducing his pedigree collie. Meanwhile, Beth is set for a Christmas surprise and Tyler spreads a rumour that Mrs Cakeworthy is pregnant - a revelation that comes as quite a shock to her husband, as they have not been intimate for some time. Nigel Harrison and Paul Bown guest star

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Its Christmas, a time of goodwill and cheer, but Del and Rodney are so sick of Grandads cooking and TV circuses that they put on their glad rags and have a festive night out at the Monte Carlo Club. However, an argument over the best romantic technique makes the pair forget their intentions, and the objects of their affections are whisked away from under their noses. Festive edition of the comedy from 1981, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Christmas proves a depressing time for Del-Boy as he tries to get over another failed romance, but he soon bounces back after finding a new lady friend. The problem is she also has a son. Christmas special from 1982, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del and Rodneys Christmas celebrations are disrupted by the unexpected arrival of their estranged father - leaving the brothers doubtful they can trust him after such a long absence. Another chance to see the 1983 festive special of John Sullivans comedy

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Festive special from 1978. Foggy films a video message to send to Noras ailing brother in Australia, so he can be reminded what a traditional British Christmas is like. Brian Wilde and Kathy Staff star

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Small Tune on a Penny Wassail
programme.desc: Feeling somewhat less than merry, Compo, Clegg and Foggy visit a friend in hospital before opening their presents. Meanwhile, Sid, Ivy, Nora and Wally Batty, have their relatives over to dinner. Christmas special from 1978, starring Peter Sallis, Bill Owen and Brian Wilde

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: And a Dewhurst Up a Fir Tree
programme.desc: Foggy anticipates the festive rush and decides to start his shopping early - but is disappointed that the shops are not selling Christmas cards in high summer. The intrepid pensioner then takes forester Big Erics offer of buying 100 fir trees, only to find they are infested with insects. Meanwhile, Compo gets de-bagged by Ivy and Nora in Sids cafe. Brian Wilde, Peter Sallis and Bill Owen star in the 1979 Christmas special

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.sub-title: Christmas Special 1991: The Father Christmas Suit
programme.desc: Hyacinth makes Richard dress as Father Christmas to hand out presents to the old folk at the church hall. Unfortunately, he visits Emmet on the way and they get drunk, leaving Elizabeth to don the costume and take his place - without Mrs Bucket noticing the switch. Festive special from 1991, starring Patricia Routledge, Clive Swift and Geoffrey Hughes

programme.desc: Pompous Captain Mainwaring proves he is a softie at heart by organising a turkey dinner as a Christmas treat for the struggling senior citizens of Walmington-on-Sea. Festive episode from 1974, starring Arthur Lowe, John Le Mesurier and John Laurie

programme.title: Gavin and Stacey
programme.desc: On Christmas Eve, the Wests join the Shipmans for one of Micks famous turkey dinners. Smithy can hardly wait to spend his first yuletide with baby Neil, but fails to realise Dave will be tagging along and playing happy families with Nessa. Meanwhile, Gavin and Stacey make an announcement that does not exactly fill their friends and relatives with joy, and Bryn has a heart-to-heart with Jason. Festive edition of the comedy from 2008, starring Mathew Horne and Joanna Page

programme.title: Men Behaving Badly
programme.desc: Tony and Garys gleeful anticipation of Christmas soon gives way to disappointment and comatose oblivion in front of the telly, and a glimpse of how respectable married life might have been with Deborah and Dorothy only underlines what a terrible time they are having. Festive special from 1997, starring Martin Clunes, Neil Morrissey, Caroline Quentin and Leslie Ash

programme.title: Bottom
programme.desc: The pals look forward to celebrating Christmas, but an unexpected guest disrupts their plans as Richie suffers delusions of grandeur and the whole spirit of the festive season is jeopardised. Anarchic comedy, starring Adrian Edmondson and Rik Mayall

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Liverpool Womens Hospital opens its doors to 16-year-old Heidi, who is accompanied by her own mum Jo, and Adele, the mother of the babys father, who has decided to take her sons place in the delivery room. Dad-to-be Gavin hopes poetry will help his jittery wife Michelle get through giving birth to their second child, and 46-year-old Jane finds herself laughing through her daughter Louises contractions as a means of coping with the stress of being a birthing partner

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: 999 Rescue Squad
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary following Yorkshire Ambulance Services Hazardous Area Response Team. A man is crushed by his own car

programme.title: 999 Rescue Squad
programme.desc: The Yorkshire Ambulance Services Hazardous Area Response Team tries to seal a major chemical spill and helps a teenager who fell down a chimney

programme.title: 999 Rescue Squad
programme.desc: Emergency services deal with the consequences of gun crime, racing to the scene when a man is shot outside a mosque

programme.title: 999 Rescue Squad
programme.desc: The Hazardous Area Response Team is called to help defuse a bomb found in Wakefield, and to rescue a BMX rider who fell and fractured his spine in woods near Leeds

programme.title: 999 Rescue Squad
programme.desc: A suspected acid attack on the streets of Bradford leads to a busy shift for the crew. Documentary following the work of Yorkshire Ambulance Services Hazardous Area Response Team

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Golden retriever poodle-cross Sukis front legs have developed abnormally and now require urgent attention as the bones of her forearms are growing at different rates, so Noel decides that major surgery is required. Beloved elderly Labrador Raffa is nearly 11 and has become lame with constant pain in his front legs, and Noel discovers cartilage erosion in both elbows. Meanwhile, five-year-old dachshund Zizi is rushed in after suddenly losing the use of her back legs overnight, and an urgent MRI scan confirms that Zizi has suffered an exploded disc

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A couple bring their 13-month-old cocker spaniel puppy in for scheduled surgery for hip dysplasia which will require two separate full hip replacements. Elsewhere, two-year-old cat Jazz is rushed in by mum Sarah suffering from a smashed femur and shattered thorax after being hit by a car, and eight-year-old dachshund Olive is treated after suddenly losing the use of her back legs

programme.title: Pete Wicks: For Dogs Sake
programme.desc: Pete travels to Northern Ireland to pick up three stray dogs and bring them back to Essex. He also meets a Shar Pei who is in constant pain and may need surgery

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Chris and Tom go to the home of a woman having suicidal thoughts and demonstrate how well trained they are at dealing with mental illness, as well as physical injury

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Ash and Jamie rush to a lady with severe chest pains who is losing consciousness, while Chris and Joel help a man with low kidney functions who has been picked up by the police

programme.title: Inside the Operating Theatre
programme.desc: A four-year-old girl has her droopy eyelid lifted, a rugby player gets his broken nose reset and a woman has an operation on her wrist after almost a year of agony

programme.title: Inside the Operating Theatre
programme.desc: Nick has an ultrasound taken from inside his body to find out if he needs open-heart surgery, and Irene has gel removed from her eye to make her see again

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: In a One Born Every Minute special, cameras follow four couples through their multiple pregnancies and births. Ana and Paul are thrilled at the prospect of becoming first-time parents to triplets, but receive worrying news at a routine scan, while Beth has to have emergency laser surgery in her womb after her babies are diagnosed with twin-to-twin transfusion syndrome. Carolyne and Gordon, already parents to four children, are shocked to discover they can expect three more, while Sophie and Carlos try to cope with the premature arrival of their two daughters

programme.title: One Born: What Happened Next?
programme.desc: Three couples who have featured on the programme share their experiences of parenthood 12 months after they originally took part. A woman explains why it will not be easy for her partner to cope with looking after their child when she returns to work, and another couple voice their concerns about the effect that starting a family has had on their health. Meanwhile, Lucy seeks her husbands approval as she decides to resume her career as an opera singer

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: The Harpers gather to celebrate Christmas once more - although unlike previous festive specials, this one reveals how the family will be faring 30 years from now. Ben is in his eighties and still as grumpy as ever, thanks to a little moisturiser Susan has not aged a bit, Janey is tipping the scales at a whopping 20 stone and Michael is trying to hide his baldness with an unconvincing wig. While Susan is put out that grandson Kenzo, now 38, has not come to visit for Christmas, Ben is quick to point out that they have had some of the worst festive holidays ever, and this one looks no different with a greed gift exchange, a rival cousin and a nativity play battle. Robert Lindsay and Zoe Wanamaker star, with a guest appearance from Nathaniel Parker. Festive special from 2009

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Paramedics are sent to help a woman whose foot was run over by a bin lorry, and a team is sent to assess a man suffering from an agonising headache that has been going on for days.

programme.title: Nick Knowles Big House Clearout
programme.desc: The presenter helps more families who are being crushed by their clutter. He begins in Portsmouth, where three generations are squeezed together in a three-bed semi thats bursting at the seams in an extraordinary challenge full of emotion and memories. When Sarahs husband Trevor suddenly passed away, she had to return from Dubai to her old house - in which her daughter Stevie and five-year-old grand-daughter were living. Coping with grief, Sarah was unable to face sorting through a lifetime of belongings, so for a year, the house has been totally packed with clutter from the attic to the outhouses, and its become the way they live

The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz show in which four players take on an extraordinary machine in the hope of winning its 10,000 pound jackpot

programme.title: Tipping Point

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Homes
programme.desc: A family thinks their 1960s house is a vintage treasure thats full of charm, but its impractical layout and frustrating kitchen are showing their age

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Homes
programme.desc: Drew and Jonathan aim to create a modern, spacious home from a choppy layout that is no longer functional for four adults living under one roof.

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Homes
programme.desc: Drew and Jonathan update the awkward floor plan of a single-story house with some 1970s quirks for two high school sweethearts who have moved 14 times in 15 years

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles and the team meet Rob and Michelle Wall and their son Noah. The couple live in a small 18th-century house in Cumbria, which is currently a half-finished renovation project that had to be put on hold when Noah was born with spina bifida. Designer Charlie Luxton is tasked with making the cold and unsafe property a special haven for the family - and as always an army of local tradesmen turn out in force to help make the dream a reality

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles meets Hereford couple Colin and Clare Gibbons, whose life together fell apart in 2012 when their eldest son Christopher was diagnosed with Duchenne muscular dystrophy, one of the most severe forms of the condition. Despite having a lovely house, it needs adapting to Christophers needs for both now and in the future, so the DIY SOS team - bolstered by dozens of local tradespeople - descend on the property to add a two-storey extension, with designer Julia Kendell on hand to ensure they stick to her vision while adding a few finishing touches of her own

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz show in which four players take on an extraordinary machine in the hope of winning its 10,000 pound jackpot

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Two years ago, Michelle and Rod Malone set about adapting their home after daughter Maddie contracted a rare brain disease that left her struggling to walk and talk. However, unforeseen problems with the project left them living in just a couple of rooms in an unsafe house. Enter Nick Knowles and the DIY SOS builders, bolstered by an army of local tradespeople, to complete what the Malones started and give it a few finishing touches, courtesy of flamboyant designer Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen

Designer Charlie Luxton is tasked with making the cold and unsafe property a special haven for the family - and as always an army of local tradesmen turn out in force to help make the dream a reality

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles meets Hereford couple Colin and Clare Gibbons, whose life together fell apart in 2012 when their eldest son Christopher was diagnosed with Duchenne muscular dystrophy, one of the most severe forms of the condition. Despite having a lovely house, it needs adapting to Christophers needs for both now and in the future, so the DIY SOS team - bolstered by dozens of local tradespeople - descend on the property to add a two-storey extension, with designer Julia Kendell on hand to ensure they stick to her vision while adding a few finishing touches of her own

programme.title: MasterChef USA
programme.desc: In the lead up to the finale, MasterChef celebrates the highs and lows of Series 15 with a compilation of highlights

programme.title: Pete Wicks: For Dogs Sake
programme.sub-title: Hugo and the Ice Cream Pups
programme.desc: Pete meets some newborn pups fighting to survive, and helps teach Hugo, a Cane Corso rescued from quarantine at Dover, how to be a dog

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel diagnoses the joint condition osteochondritis dissecans in a hyperactive ridgeback named Loki, and discusses treatment options with his owners. Newfoundland Hugo is referred for his hip dysplasia, but Noel discovers issues with his elbow and knee joints, while Carol and Nigel bring their mischievous seven-month-old Havana kitten Zahra following a mysterious accident at home, which resulted in a broken leg

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: An energetic one-year-old bull terrier puppy called Apple comes into the surgery with an ankle problem, and Noel hopes a custom-made, 3D-printed implant may give this beloved pet a new lease of life. He also treats a two-year-old Siamese cat with a broken leg, shattered pelvis and suspected spinal injury after being hit by a van, while four-year-old collie cross Rosco is tested for hip dysplasia

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Three more sets of parents-to-be arrive at Liverpool Womens Hospital to welcome new additions to their families, including 29-year-old Kate and her 32-year-old husband Pete, whose short-term memory was damaged following a hard-fought battle against meningitis and encephalitis 10 years earlier. The pair hope Petes brain injury will not stop him from being able to recall this memorable moment in the future. Also featured is third-time mother Lisa, whose previous two labours only lasted six and four hours respectively, and former drama school student Hayley, who already has children with her other-half Stephen, and has resolved to appreciate every moment with her family after losing her own mother at an early age

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The midwives of Liverpool Womens Hospital invite viewers into the delivery suites one last time, introducing 27-year-old Gina and her partner James. The pair met at university, while Gina was on an exchange programme from Shanghai, and made their long-distance relationship work by chatting through cuddly toys via the internet. However, they must now demonstrate their maturity and become parents. Meanwhile, self-confessed baby machine Margy arrives expecting her fifth child, and childhood sweethearts Craig and Sarah, who faced parenthood at an early age, look forward to taking their next baby back to their own home rather than to their parents

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Janine and Adam assist a woman who is threatening to jump out of a first-floor window, and husband and wife team Ann and Kevin are called out to help Anns sick Dad

programme.title: Hungry for It
programme.desc: Ten rookie cooks take the ultimate crash course for how to make it in the food business, guided by their mentors Big Zuu and Kayla Greer. Stacey Dooley presents. The cooks create levelled-up party food and dish up burgers to 100 hungry diners

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo stops in Wolverhampton, where he finds out about the impact of Enoch Powells 1968 speech. He also visits Kingsford Country Park on the outskirts of Kidderminster, investigates pigeon-racing in Worcester, and eventually looks into Cheltenhams jazz festival

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: From Tewkesbury in Gloucestershire, Michael Portillo heads to the castle of Eastnor at the foot of the Malvern Hills. He also visits Coleford in the Forest of Dean, Slimbridge in Gloucestershire, and Bristol Temple Meads. From there he heads to Filton to investigate the centre of Britains post-war aviation industry

programme.title: Joanna Lumleys India
programme.desc: Joanna Lumley travels back to the country of her birth, travelling the length and breadth of India to explore its diverse landscapes and cultural traditions. In this episode, her epic journey begins in Tamil Nadu, where she witnesses religious ceremonies in glorious temples, before visiting Gangtok in Sikkim, the place where her mother lived as a child

programme.title: Joanna Lumleys India
programme.desc: Joanna meets the Maharaja of Dungarpur who shows her around his lakeside palace, and a Dalit community in Gujarat, considered to be Indias lowest caste. Braving the roads of Mumbai, Joanna takes a ride in the citys only all-female taxi company and visits the Times of India, where her uncle was editor of the paper in the 1930s and 40s. She then overcomes her fear of heights to explore the World One Tower, soon to be Mumbais tallest luxury residential building

programme.title: Trawlermen: Hunting the Catch
programme.desc: Off the coast of Yorkshire Siwrengale is heading out for the beginning of the North Sea whelk season. Skipper Darren Warters is on the hunt with sons Regan and Lewis. But winter storms have badly damaged their pots - and miles of rope must be untangled before they can begin fishing in earnest. Reliance III is south east of Shetland, where skipper John Clarke is hunting for whiting, while Endeavour 5 is far off in the North Atlantic in search of squid - but when the prey proves elusive, the pressure starts to mount

programme.title: Trawlermen: Hunting the Catch
programme.desc: The crew of the scalloper Golden Promise pushes Force 6 winds to reach newly opening scallops beds ahead of their rivals. With the boat first to the grounds, they are in for a big pay day - but only once they cover the £8,000 fuel expenses to get here. Family owned trawler Adenia hunts for 1,000 tons of mackerel to sell to the lucrative Asian sushi market, and skipper Ivan Toms and son Rhys fish Cornwalls inshore waters in Maxines Pride, one of the oldest trawlers in UK waters. Can they catch enough to give themselves a wage and put money aside for repairs?

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Paul collects a cherished 1924 Rover 9 thats been in the same family since the 1950s and only had one previous owner before that

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek heads north to pick up a 1954 Morgan +4 coupe in mint condition and believed to be just one of three still on the road

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek waxes lyrical about a pristine Jaguar XJ8 and a Ford Model T van tests his driving skills

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: Gus and Will go for the once-maligned Austin Maestro. The car they want to buy has already been sold but the seller has another - his own - on the driveway. Can they do a deal?

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of animals that live in the desert, including a pride of desert lions that risks hunting a giraffe several times their size. The film also features an immense swarm of locusts, sand grouse flying for 120 miles to gather water for their offspring, and an unprecedented recording of a tiny bat defending itself against one of the worlds deadliest scorpions

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Wildlife that inhabit the worlds grasslands, areas that are struck by some of the most dramatic seasonal changes seen in the world. The programme features footage of Brazils giant anteaters and Asian saiga antelope, as well as lions engaging in ferocious battles with buffalo in the flooded Okavango, bee-eaters taking advantage of elephants to help them catch insects, and caribou embarking on migrations across the freezing northern tundra, stalked every step of the way by predatory Arctic wolves

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of wild animals that have made a home in cities, including leopards on the streets of Mumbai, peregrine falcons hunting among New Yorks skyscrapers, hyenas that live peacefully alongside the people of Harar, macaques in Jaipur, and langurs in Jodhpur, which are regarded as having great religious significance by the citizens. The programme also examines how some animals are struggling to survive in urban environments, and questions how cities can be built to serve their needs as well as those of the human inhabitants

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough investigates what rising temperatures will mean for people and wildlife in the polar regions, and how changes there could affect the rest of the planet. He discovers polar bears in the Arctic are going hungry as the sea ice they hunt on disappears, and accompanies scientists studying waterfalls of meltwater in Greenland that are leading to a rise in global sea levels. From the Antarctic there are images of the break-up of the Wilkins Ice Shelf, which covered an area the size of Jamaica

programme.title: Simon Reeves South America
programme.desc: The last leg of Simons journey through South America takes him from Chiles Atacama Desert right down to Tierra Del Fuego, the most southerly inhabited place on Earth. In the Atacama, one of the driest places on the planet with is as little as 1mm of rain per year, Simon discovers shocking evidence of human pollution

programme.title: Robson Green: Worlds Most Amazing Walks
programme.desc: Robson Green walks a beautiful but lesser-known route in the Douro Valley in Northern Portugal, rich in ancient art, wildlife and world-famous wine

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: Gus and Will go for the once-maligned Austin Maestro. The car they want to buy has already been sold but the seller has another - his own - on the driveway. Can they do a deal?

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Paul and Jack head to Staffordshire to pick up five vehicles from collector Robs colossal barn, including a Mini and a Morris Minor

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A delightful collection of British classics comes up for auction, including an Austin A35 and a Hillman Avenger Estate in stunning condition. An E-Type Jaguar also hits the auction

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Three MGs from the 70s turn up at the garage, still covered in original factory wax. Nobody can believe it, or value them. A Morris 1000 turns up at the auction along with a TR7 V8

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Three rare Alvises get the auction buyers going when put under the hammer. A Chevy Corvette which started its journey in Saudi Arabia makes its way to Thornton le Dale for the sale

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Dave gets a nasty surprise when he opens the bonnet of a fast Ford from the 80s, and an Austin Heavy 12 nearly a century old sets off a bidding war at the auction

programme.title: Joanna Lumleys India
programme.desc: Joannas adventures across India conclude as she explores Rajasthan, Delhi and the mountainous North West, before ending in Kashmir, the place of her birth. Her first stop takes her to the Ranthambhore National Park, where she learns about the Wildlife Protection Society of Indias tiger conservation programmes. Joannas next stop takes her to the city of Delhi, where she begins her exploration of the capital at Humayuns Tomb, before ending her 5000 mile journey in Srinagar in Kashmi, the place where she was born

programme.title: Joanna Lumleys Japan
programme.desc: Joanna begins a 2,000-mile journey across Japan in Hokkaido, where she meets one of the most important animals in Japanese culture, the red-crowned crane. She arrives in Sapporo during the middle of the annual Snow Festival and meets members of the local indigenous community, before travelling into the Fukushima exclusion zone and taking a bullet train from Nagano to Tokyo

programme.desc: Paul is picking up a stunning 1961 Vauxhall Cresta, inspired by American design, the car changed the face of British motoring

programme.desc: Chronicling the events that brought about the demise of the Third Reich, as the Allies arrived at the gates of Berlin and Hitler boarded himself up in his bunker, where it is believed he committed suicide. Narrated by Laurence Olivier

programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the experts visit Charlecote Park, near Stratford-upon-Avon, to value items including an outstanding collection of gold boxes, a royal gift given in exceptional circumstances and a peculiar piece of Beatles memorabilia

programme.desc: Derek checks out an abandoned 1985 Renault 4 and an MGB Roadster that hasnt seen the light of day for 36 years, and Jack heads to Rotherham to pick up a pair of rare Bond Bugs.

Cameras follow barn owls as they hunt for small mammals through the British countryside, and a heath potter wasp builds an intricate clay pot for her young, captured in its entirety for the very first time. Plus, the farmers doing what they can to help our countryside creatures

programme.desc: Alex Polizzi climbs aboard floating hotel the African Queen, situated on the Thames, to help owners Bonny and Andy Cowley improve their 30 per cent occupancy. programme.desc: Part one of two. Drama telling the true story of how a brilliant scientist and pioneering detective joined forces to create the most significant advance in modern criminal investigation. In 1984, Dr Alec Jeffreys (John Simm) unlocks a remarkable technique to read every persons unique DNA fingerprint, while a few miles away, DCS David Baker (David Threlfall) leads the search for the murderer of a local schoolgirl. Two years later, a second youngster is killed and a teenager confesses - but denies the first crime. Certain that the same man was responsible for both incidents, Baker approaches Jeffreys to help prove his theory. Co-starring Robert Glenister, Anna Madeley, Andrew Tiernan and Lorcan Cranitch

programme.sub-title: Paul OGrady: For the Love of Indian Dogs
programme.desc: The comedian and dog-lover presents his final report from Delhi, where 400,000 pooches live on the streets. Paul joins in with the celebrations for Diwali, the Hindu festival of light, with the people and animals of one of Delhis oldest dog shelters. He also helps a traumatised puppy make new friends, joins medics as they rush to rescue a four-week-old street pup who may have been hit by a car and falls in love with an elderly black labrador who lives at the rescue centre. Will he be able to resist bringing the pooch back to Britain with him?

programme.title: Inside MandS
programme.desc: Cameras are invited inside every corner of high street giant Marks and Spencer during its busiest time of year. programme.title: The Guards: Inside the K
programme.desc: Documentary providing unprecedented access to the garda of The K, Irelands busiest policing district which includes Blanchardstown, Finglas and Cabra

programme.title: Trigger Point
programme.desc: Alex contacts the police with critical information about a new attack planned for that day, but Commander Francis warns the team against placing too much trust in him - when the attack does come, its shocking in its ingenuity and deadly intent. When Alex calls again with more intelligence, the team must split resources to work out if an unscrupulous financier could be targeted next.

programme.title: Ana Kriegel: A Young Life Lost
programme.desc: In May 2018, Russian-Irish teenager Ana Kriegel was lured from her home and brutally killed in a derelict house in Lucan. The awful crime was all the more disturbing when her killers were revealed to be two 13-year-old boys - now the youngest convicted murderers in the history of the state. Here, senior journalists, barristers and family friends tell Anas story, looking at the circumstances around her murder, the extensive Garda investigation and the trial that followed. Featuring a series of new photographs released by Anas family, the documentary also examines the sentencing in this unprecedented case and explores the lasting impact of Anas death

programme.title: Poldark
programme.desc: As a doctor arrives to make a study of lung diseases at Wheal Leisure, Ross sets about forming an alliance with his fellow mine-owners to build their own smelting company and break Warleggans stranglehold on copper prices. However, Francis is deeply in debt to George - and what money he does have is being spent on lavish gifts for ambitious prostitute Margaret. Demelza resolves to lift Veritys spirits by reconciling her with her lost love Captain Blamey, and theres a new woman in Marks life - but she demands he finds her a home before they are married

programme.desc: The host is joined by eight-time Oscar-nominee Glenn Close, who is joining the cast of Wake Up Dead Man: A Knives Out Mystery. Also on the sofa are Emmy-winning Swedish star Alexander Skarsgard, who is playing a biker in British love story Pillion, actress and national treasure Miriam Margolyes, discussing her anthology The Little Book of Miriam, and Bridgerton star Nicola Coughlan, who is taking to the National Theatre stage. Plus, Jessie J performs HAPPY from her album Dont Tease Me with a Good Time

programme.title: Love Island: All Stars
programme.desc: The show is in full swing and the Islanders are diving headfirst into the whirlwind of dating and drama, but there may already be trouble in paradise for the couples.

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Hustle star Adrian Lester discusses his role in historical action series Renegade Nell, Cate Blanchett chats about her starring role in Australian period drama The New Boy, while Kate Winslet discusses playing the chancellor of a collapsing authoritarian regime in mini-series The Regime. Plus, singer-songwriter Dua Lipa talks about her latest work and Justin Timberlake chats and performs his new single Selfish

programme.title: Pressure Pad
programme.desc: General knowledge quiz, hosted by John Barrowman, in which two teams of five players are pitted against each other inside an illuminated arena, known as the Pressure Pad. The team with the most players remaining for the final round will put itself in the strongest position to win the rolling jackpot on offer

programme.title: The Chase Australia
programme.desc: Andrew OKeefe presents the Down Under version of the quiz show in which four people must work together to beat the Chaser and win a cash prize

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase

programme.title: Million Pound Pawn
programme.desc: In Sheffield, Dan is pushed hard by retired PR executive Jayne, who is looking to make a big return on several designer handbags to help pay for her daughter Charlottes fairy tale wedding. In Cheshires golden triangle, Kathy meets savvy watch collector Anthony who is looking to trade up his collection of luxury watches for one worth more than £100,000

programme.title: Cooking with the Stars
programme.desc: Emma Willis and Tom Allen host the celebrity cooking contest as Carol Vorderman, Linford Christie and Ellie Simmonds try to impress their loved ones with family favourite dishes they serve up in the studio. With double the amount of meals to deliver this time, the pressure is on as they battle it out for a place in the semi-final, while the stars who fail to impress the shows chefs head into the dreaded cook-off

programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Sarah Greene host the quiz in which five contestants race in moving podiums across the studio floor to try to win £5,000.
